StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genome Wide Association Study of Asthma

Person.Organization: CHILDREN'S HOSP OF PHILADELPHIAUNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA
COLD SPRING HARBOR LABORATORYCHILDREN'S HOSP OF PHILADELPHIA

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Drs. Sleiman and Hakonarson request that publications resulting from these data cite their original publication: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20032318. The discovery part of the study was supported by an Institute Development Award from Children's Hospital of Philadelphia (to Dr. Hakonarson), a grant from the state of Pennsylvania (4100042728, to Dr. Hakonarson) and grant from the Lundbeck Foundation (to Dr. Sleiman). Replication data were supported in part by the Intramural Research Program of the National Human Genome Research Institute, National Institutes of Health (to Dr. Mathias) and the National Heart Lung Institute, Imperial College, London UK (to Dr. Cookson). Dr. Barnes was supported in part by the Mary Beryl Patch Turnbull Scholar program. Other investigators contributed data, including the Multicenter Asthma Genetics in Childhood Study (MAGICS) and the International Study of Asthma and Allergies in Childhood (ISAAC) both of which were used for replication.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the Genome Wide Association Study of Asthma data must be related to Asthma and atopy.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Asthma and atopy)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-AS-AT
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Asthma and atopy.
